content:
Protein Multiple Sequence Alignment: Systematic Evaluation and Benchmarking

Deploy and Benchmark Popular MSA Tools for Protein Analysis

Multiple Sequence Alignment (MSA) is a fundamental technique in computational biology for comparing three or more protein or nucleotide sequences to identify conserved regions, evolutionary relationships, and functional domains. This pipeline provides a systematic framework for running and evaluating multiple MSA methods with comprehensive quality metrics.

Key Features

  • Multiple Alignment Tools: Deploy one or many popular MSA tools including FAMSA, FOLDMASON, CLUSTALO, MAFFT, MUSCLE5, TCOFFEE, and more

  • Systematic Benchmarking: Compare alignment quality across different methods using standardized evaluation metrics

  • Structure-Based Alignment: Support for protein structure-based alignments using tools like 3DCOFFEE, MTMALIGN, and FOLDMASON

  • Guide Tree Options: Flexible guide tree generation with multiple algorithms

  • Comprehensive Reporting: MultiQC reports with alignment statistics and quality metrics

Supported Alignment Methods

Sequence-Based Aligners

  • FAMSA: Fast and accurate multiple sequence alignment

  • CLUSTALO: Clustal Omega - widely used general-purpose MSA tool

  • MAFFT: Multiple alignment using Fast Fourier Transform

  • MUSCLE5: Latest version of MUSCLE alignment algorithm

  • TCOFFEE: T-Coffee alignment with consistency-based scoring

  • KALIGN: Fast and accurate multiple sequence alignment

Structure-Based Aligners

  • 3DCOFFEE: Structure-aware version of T-Coffee

  • MTMALIGN: Multiple structure alignment using TM-align

  • FOLDMASON: Protein structure alignment using Foldseek

Input Requirements

Samplesheet Format (CSV)

Define input sequences and optional reference alignments:

id,fasta,reference,optional_data,template
my_alignment,sequences.fasta,reference.aln,,
structure_based,proteins.fasta,ref.aln,structures.pdb,template.pdb

Columns:

  • id: Unique identifier for the alignment dataset

  • fasta: Path to input FASTA file with sequences

  • reference: Optional reference alignment for benchmarking

  • optional_data: Additional data (e.g., PDB structures for structure-based methods)

  • template: Template structure for structure-guided alignment

Toolsheet Format (CSV)

Specify which alignment tools and parameters to use:

tree,args_tree,aligner,args_aligner
FAMSA,,FAMSA,
NONE,,CLUSTALO,--threads=4
FAMSA,,MAFFT,--maxiterate 1000

Columns:

  • tree: Guide tree tool (FAMSA, CLUSTALO, MAFFT, NONE)

  • args_tree: Additional arguments for tree generation

  • aligner: Alignment tool to use

  • args_aligner: Tool-specific alignment parameters

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Input File Summary: Optional statistics on input sequences (length, composition, etc.)

  2. Guide Tree Generation: Optional phylogenetic tree to guide alignment process

  3. Sequence Alignment: Run selected MSA tools on input sequences

  4. Alignment Evaluation: Calculate quality metrics if reference alignment provided

  5. Reporting: Generate MultiQC report summarizing all results

Key Parameters

  • --input: Path to samplesheet CSV defining datasets

  • --tools: Path to toolsheet CSV specifying alignment methods

  • --seqs: Direct path to FASTA file (alternative to samplesheet)

  • --aligner: Single aligner to use (if not using toolsheet)

  • --pdbs_dir: Directory containing PDB structure files for structure-based alignment

  • --skip_stats: Skip input file summary statistics

  • --calc_sim: Calculate sequence similarity (default: false)

  • --calc_seq_stats: Calculate general sequence statistics (default: true)

Output Files

Alignments

  • Aligned sequences: Multiple sequence alignments in FASTA format

  • Guide trees: Phylogenetic trees used for alignment (if generated)

Evaluation Metrics

  • Alignment scores: Quality metrics comparing to reference (if provided)

  • Sequence statistics: Length distributions, gap content, conservation scores

Reports

  • MultiQC Report: Comprehensive summary of all alignment runs and metrics

  • Tool comparisons: Benchmarking results across different MSA methods

Use Cases

  • Comparative Genomics: Identify conserved regions across homologous proteins

  • Phylogenetic Analysis: Generate alignments for evolutionary tree construction

  • Protein Family Analysis: Study domain conservation and functional motifs

  • Structure Prediction: Create alignments for homology modeling

  • Tool Benchmarking: Systematically compare MSA algorithm performance

  • Method Development: Evaluate new alignment approaches against established tools

Best Practices

  • Sequence Selection: Include sequences with >30% identity for reliable alignment

  • Dataset Size: Balance between comprehensiveness and computational time

  • Reference Alignments: Use curated reference alignments from databases like BALIBASE or PREFAB for benchmarking

  • Structure Information: Include PDB structures when available for structure-based methods

  • Tool Selection: Test multiple aligners as performance varies by sequence characteristics

Perfect for Research in: Evolutionary biology • Structural bioinformatics • Protein engineering • Drug discovery • Functional genomics • Computational biology • Algorithm development
